DOC.brief_summary: The main objective is to assess the efficacy of Alfentanil for pain in children treated by tracheal suction in pediatric intensive care units in France, compared to Sufentanyl, the current standard treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Alfentanil Versus Sufentanil for Pain in Children During for Tracheal Suction
DOC.criteria: child between 1 month and 15 years of age affiliation to the French social security system or equivalent child receiving mechanical ventilation for at least 4 hours and less than 48 hours ventilation to be provided for at least 8 hours less than 30 days in pediatric intensive care child under intravenous sedation consent of both parents consent of child when possible curarized child ketamine treatment children suffering from facial and/or severe brain traumatism known hypersensitivity reaction to morphine or intolerance insufficiency to sufentanyl respiratory chronic obstructive pulmonary disease myasthenia treatment with morphine agonistsantagonists, or combination with MAOIs renal or liver disorders preterm birth of more than one month of life (but not at full term by corrected age) associated treatment or pathology contraindicating administration of Sufentanyl epidural
